Comms¶

Atomic Constraint¶

This module defines an atomic constraint, the simples form of constraint possible. It expresses that any offer which has a perticular assignement will never be accepted. Good baseline for addapting for more complicated constraints

class pyneg.comms.atomic_constraint.AtomicConstraint(issue: str, value: str)[source]¶

Bases: object

Atomic constraint, the simples form of constraint possible. It expresses that any offer which has a perticular assignement will never be accepted. Good baseline for addapting for more complicated constraints

__init__(issue: str, value: str)[source]¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

is_satisfied_by_assignment(issue: str, value: str) → bool[source]¶

Determines whether a perticular assignement satisfies this constraint. For example: >>> AtomicConstraint(“A”,”first”).is_satisfied_by_assignment(“A”,”first”) False >>> AtomicConstraint(“A”,”first”).is_satisfied_by_assignment(“A”,”second”) True

Parameters

  • issue (str) – The issue the potential assignement is refering too

  • value (str) – The value the potential assignement is refering too

Returns

True iff the assignement is satisfied

Return type

bool

is_satisfied_by_offer(offer: pyneg.comms.offer.Offer) → bool[source]¶

Checks if a whole offer is satisfied by the constraint. For atomic constraints this means just checking all of the assignements individually.

Parameters

offer (Offer) – The offer to be checked

Returns

True iff the assignement is allowed under this constraint

Return type

bool

Message¶

This module defines the Message class, which is the main mode of communication between agents.

class pyneg.comms.message.Message(sender_name: str, recipient_name: str, type_: pyneg.types.message_type.MessageType, offer: Optional[pyneg.comms.offer.Offer], constraint: Optional[pyneg.comms.atomic_constraint.AtomicConstraint] = None)[source]¶

Bases: object

This class is the main mode of communication between agents. It contains a sender and recipient name (mainly for logging purposes), a type (defined in Message Types), and optionally an offer and constraint. The message contain an offer if and only if it is either ACCEPT or OFFER.

__init__(sender_name: str, recipient_name: str, type_: pyneg.types.message_type.MessageType, offer: Optional[pyneg.comms.offer.Offer], constraint: Optional[pyneg.comms.atomic_constraint.AtomicConstraint] = None)[source]¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

True iff sender is ending the negotiation early

Offer¶

Defines the Offer class.

class pyneg.comms.offer.Offer(values_by_issue: Union[Dict[str, Dict[str, float]], Dict[str, float]], indent_level: int = 1)[source]¶

Bases: object

This essentially is a function from all of the issue value pairs to {0.0,1.0}. Can be repesended as a NestedDict or an AtomicDict. The assignements should be binary and the sum of all assignements for an issue should sum to 1.0 (i.e. exactly one value should be assigned 1.0 and all others 0.0). Note that the assignements should be floats instead of ints or bools. this is for compatibility with ProbLog.

e.g. >>> nested = {“First”: {“A”:0.0, “B”:1.0}, “Second”:{“C”:1.0,”D”:0.0}} >>> atomic = {“First_A”:0.0, “First_B”:1.0, “Second_C”:1.0, “Second_D”:0.0}

__init__(values_by_issue: Union[Dict[str, Dict[str, float]], Dict[str, float]], indent_level: int = 1)[source]¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

get_chosen_value(issue: str) → str[source]¶

Each issue has exactly one value that it “chooses” i.e. has assigned 1 to. This one returns that value.

Parameters

issue (str) – The issue of which you want to get the chosen value.

Raises

RuntimeError – raises when no choice is made

Returns

the value chosen by the offer.

Return type

str

is_assigned(issue: str, value: str) → bool[source]¶

Checks whether the passed issue value pair is the one chosen by this offer

Parameters

  • issue (str) – The issue to check

  • value (str) – The value to check

Returns

True iff this offer poposes the asssignement of value to issue

Return type

bool

get_issues() → Iterable[str][source]¶

Returns all issues associated with this offer

Returns

an iterable containting the issues associated with this offer

Return type

Iterable[str]

get_problog_dists() → str[source]¶

Formats the offer as a distribution over the atomic issue value pairs. This is just so ProbLog agents can reason about them.

>>> Offer(atomic).get_problog_dists()
0.0::First_A;1.0::First_B.
1.0::Second_C;0.0::Second_D.
Returns

A string expressing the offer in valid ProbLog as a distribution over the atomic issue value pairs.

Return type

str

get_sparse_repr() → FrozenSet[Tuple[str, str]][source]¶

returns a sparse reperesentation of itself. This means a frozenset of issue value pairs, where the value is the one assigned byt the offer. Handy for logging and hashing

>>> Offer(atomic).get_sparse_repr()
frozenset({('First', 'B'), ('Second', 'C')})
Returns

A frozen set containt assigned issue value pairs

Return type

FrozenSet[Tuple[str,str]]

get_sparse_str_repr() → str[source]¶

returns a sparse string reperesentation of itself. Mainly useful for logging

>>> Offer(atomic).get_sparse_str_repr()
[First->B, Second->C]
Returns

A string of the mapping

Return type

str
